import React, { Component } from "react"; import API from "../utils/API"; import Card from "react-bootstrap/Card"; import Button from "react-bootstrap/Button"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; class CSS extends Component { state = { cssInfo: [] }; componentDidMount() { this.loadAll(); } loadAll = () => { API.getAll("visualstudiocode") .then(res => { this.setState({ cssInfo: res.data }); }) .catch(error => { console.log("error: ", error); }); }; delete = (category, id) => { API.deleteOne(id) .then(res => this.loadAll()) .catch(err => console.log(err)); }; render() { return (


CSS

You can find more info, documents and very detailed videos in the buttons below.

Go to CSS CSS Documents CSS Videos CSS W3Schools Moz://a

Videos

Notice that this div element has a left margin of 25%. This is because the side navigation is set to 25% width. If you remove the margin, the sidenav will overlay/sit on top of this div.

Also notice that we have set overflow:auto to sidenav. This will add a scrollbar when the sidenav is too long (for example if it has over 50 links inside of it).
